content: 7. **Declaration** - The validity of this Policy is subject to the condition precedent that: (a) for the risk insured, You have never had any insurance terminated in the last twelve (12) months due solely or in part to a breach of any premium payment condition; or (b) if You have declared that You have breached any premium payment condition in respect of a previous policy taken up with another insurer in the last twelve (12) months: i. You have fully paid all outstanding premium for time on risk calculated by the previous insurer based on the customary short period rate in respect of the previous policy; and ii. a copy of the written confirmation from the previous insurer to this effect is first provided by You to Us before cover incepts.
questions: How does the policy's validity depend on the insured's history of premium payment breaches within the last twelve months, and what documentation is required if such a breach has occurred?

What are the conditions that must be met if the insured has had a previous insurance policy terminated due to a premium payment breach, and how does this affect the commencement of coverage under this policy?

In what way does the requirement to provide written confirmation from a previous insurer impact the activation of coverage when there has been a a breach of premium payment conditions in the past year?
How does the policy treat situations where the insured has never had any insurance terminated due to premium payment issues versus when they have declared such breaches?
What is the significance of the customary short period rate in calculating outstanding premiums for previous policies, and how does this calculation affect the insured's eligibility for coverage?
If an insured fails to provide written confirmation from the previous insurer regarding premium payment settlement, what is the impact on the validity of this policy?
How does the policy define the time frame relevant to previous premium payment breaches, and what are the implications for policies terminated more than twelve months ago?
